Package ru.ashemchuk.graph

Interface Graph

All Known Implementing Classes:
AdjacencyList, AdjacencyMatrix, IncidenceMatrix
public interface Graph
Represents a graph data structure with various operations. Provides default implementations for graph sorting, equality comparison, and file loading.

  • Method Details

    • addEdge

      void addEdge(Edge e)
      Adds a directed edge to the graph. If start or end vertex is not in graph - edge won't be added.
      Parameters:
      e - the edge to be added

    • deleteEdge

      void deleteEdge(Edge e)
      Removes a directed edge from the graph. If edge, start or end of edge not in graph - nothing's going to happen.
      Parameters:
      e - the edge to be removed

    • addVertex

      void addVertex(Vertex v)
      Adds a vertex to the graph. If v already in graph - nothing's going to happen.
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex to be added

    • deleteVertex

      void deleteVertex(Vertex v)
      Removes a vertex from the graph and its incident edges.
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex to be removed

    • getNeighbours

      List<Vertex> getNeighbours(Vertex v)
      Returns a list of all vertices that are directly reachable from the given vertex.
      Parameters:
      v - the source vertex
      Returns:
      a list of neighboring vertices

    • getVerticesCount

      int getVerticesCount()
      Returns the number of vertices in the graph.
      Returns:
      the number of vertices

    • getVertices

      List<Vertex> getVertices()
      Returns a list of all vertices in the graph.
      Returns:
      a list of vertices

    • sort

      default List<Vertex> sort(Sorter algo)
      Sorts the graph using the specified sorting algorithm.
      Parameters:
      algo - the sorting algorithm to use
      Returns:
      a sorted list of vertices

    • sort

      default List<Vertex> sort()
      Sorts the graph using the default topological sort algorithm.
      Returns:
      a topologically sorted list of vertices

    • equalsToGraph

      default boolean equalsToGraph(Graph g)
      Compares this graph with another graph for equality. Two graphs are considered equal if they have the same vertices with the same names and the same adjacency relationships after topological sorting.
      Parameters:
      g - the graph to compare with
      Returns:
      true if the graphs are equal, false otherwise

    • fromFile

      default void fromFile(String path)
      Loads graph data from a file. The file should contain lines with pairs of vertex names separated by space, representing directed edges from the first vertex to the second vertex. Incorrect lines will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the file containing graph data
